article.title: Raytheon Awarded up to $104 Million for Long-Range Radar Operations
article.text: The U.S. Navy’s Naval Supply Systems Command (NAVSUP) has awarded Raytheon Company, Chesapeake, Virginia, up to $104 million to conduct operations and maintenance for the Relocatable Over-the-Horizon Radar (ROTHR) program, the company recently announced. ROTHR is a long-range surveillance radar used by the U.S. government in counter narco-terrorism operations. Raytheon designed and built ROTHR and will provide operations support, modernization and maintenance of the radar system.
